intro: Bulbophyllum latibrachiatum var. latibrachiatum, commonly known as the broad-armed Bulbophyllum, is a species of orchid native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its striking, often brightly colored flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid tropical environments. Its leaves are usually elongated and革质 (leathery), providing structural support and aiding in water retention. The orchid's unique floral structure and vibrant hues make it a popular choice among orchid enthusiasts.
